Uses of Class
library.utils.InvalidFileException

  • Packages that use InvalidFileException 
    Package Description
    library.controllers  
    library.io  

    • Uses of InvalidFileException in library.controllers

      Methods in library.controllers that throw InvalidFileException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ReaderController.activateReader(Reader selectedReader)
      call the handler, activates the reader and refresh the memory
      void BorrowController.addNewBorrow(java.lang.String readerId, java.lang.String bookId)
      calls the file handle to create a new borrow and make the book unavailable and refreshes the memory
      void ReaderController.addNewReader(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String address)
      with the information creates a new reader with a new random ID and add "1" as the active because all new readers are active readers
      void AvailabilityController.addReaderToQueue(java.lang.String bookId, java.lang.String readerId)
      add the Reader to the queue and refresh the memory, will throw exceptions, if reader is already in queue or if the reader already have the book but the program will keep running smoothly
      void ReaderController.deactivateReader(Reader selectedReader)
      call the handler, deactivates the reader and refresh the memory
      void BaseController.edit(T element)
      calls the respective file handler to edit a line in the CSV
      void ReaderController.editReaderInfo(Reader r, java.lang.String newFirstName, java.lang.String newLastName, java.lang.String newAddress)
      edits the new information for a specific reader
      Availability[] AvailabilityController.loadFile()
      This method calls the the file handler, loads the file, with the Availabilities gets the readers by the Id in the CSV Column and enqueue them into the queue of the availability object and loads the array with all the objects into the Cache Memory ( Models In Memory )
      abstract T[] BaseController.loadFile()
      this method will return the object of the controller that is using it,by calling its respective File Handler, for example if the BookController is using the method it will call the Book File Handler, load the CSV and return an Array of Books each Controller will determine how this method will be handle
      Book[] BookController.loadFile()
      load the book CSV and save all the books in the cache memory (Models In Memory)
      Borrow[] BorrowController.loadFile()
      calls the file handler and reads the CSV, saves all the borrows in the Cache Memory (Models In Memory)
      Reader[] ReaderController.loadFile()
      calls the file handler loads the file and updates the cache memory
      void AvailabilityController.removeFirstReaderFromQueue(java.lang.String bookId)
      will dequeue the first reader in the queue
      void BorrowController.returnBook(java.lang.String borrowId)
      calls the file handler edit the line to return the book updates the availability of the book refreshes the memory

    • Uses of InvalidFileException in library.io

      Methods in library.io that throw InvalidFileException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void BaseFileHandler.editLine(T element)
      edits a specific line in the file.
      T[] BaseFileHandler.readFile()
      this class will read any CSV and will return an Array of objects of the type that the controller requires
